text: Robert Hugo, Duke of Parma and Piacenza (Italian: Roberto Ugo di Borbone- Parma; 7 August 1909 - 15 November 1974) was the head of the House of Bourbon- Parma and the pretender to the defunct throne of the Duchy of Parma between 1959 and 1974. ==Life== Robert Hugo was born at Schloss Weilburg in Baden bei Wien, the second but eldest surviving son of Elias, Duke of Parma and Archduchess Maria Anna of Austria (1882–1940). He succeeded his father Elias as head of the House of Bourbon-Parma upon his death in 1959, and maintained his style until his death in 1974 in Vienna. He died unmarried and without issue, and was succeeded by his agnatic half-uncle Xavier. ==Honours== * Calabrian House of Bourbon-Two Sicilies Knight Grand Cross of Justice of the Calabrian Two Sicilian Order of Saint George.Constantinian Order ==Ancestry== ==See also== *Duchy of Parma *House of Bourbon-Parma ==References== Category:Pretenders to the throne of Parma Category:Princes of Parma and Piacenza Category:Princes of Bourbon-Parma Category:House of Bourbon-Parma Category:Knights of the Golden Fleece of Spain Category:1909 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Knights Grand Cross of Justice of the Sacred Military Constantinian Order of Saint George
title: Robert Hugo, Duke of Parma
